content.question: A curve is defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, a, t, plus b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, c t, plus d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are nonzero constants. Which of the following gives the slope of the line tangent to the curve at the point <math alttext="with coordinates x of t, comma y of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
